subject: Critical Thinking
title: What Is Ethics? Morality Beyond 'Just Follow the Rules'
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Is Ethics? Morality Beyond 'Just Follow the Rules'.

hook.text: A child asks: 'Why is stealing wrong?' You answer: 'Because it's the rule.' They ask: 'But who made the rule?

buildup.text: Ethics is the philosophical study of right & wrong ‚Äì not just WHAT the rules are, but WHY they exist & whether they're.

discovery.text: Three main approaches: consequentialism, deontology, virtue ethics. Each answers 'why' differently.

twist.text: No single framework solves every dilemma. That's not a bug ‚Äì it's the nature of moral complexity.

climax.text: Ethics doesn't give you answers. It gives you better questions and more rigorous ways to think about them.

punchline.text: Rules tell you what to do. Ethics tells you why ‚Äî and when to break them.

quiz.question: What are the three main approaches to ethics?
